messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Simon Chappell"
<simonpeterchappell@...> wrote:
>
> I'd like some thoughts from the list on a little something that I've
> written. The essay is called "The Trouble With JUnit" and can be found
> at the following URL.
>
> http://simonpeter.org/technology/writings/thetroublewithjunit.html

I agree with the sentiments expressed here. I thnk that most of the
problem is related to the difference between writing unit tests after
the code, and writing unit tests before the code.

My own personal epiphany about TDD came from reading Jeff Langr's
series of articles about building an object-relational database
mapping layer. That can be found here:
http://langrsoft.com/dbtdd.shtml (Thanks Jeff!)

Hope that helps someone,
Nick


Minor nit: It's nice come across an engineer that can write well, but
I think you confuse "its" and "it's" in a few places.
